data.text: @JSmiffey @latimeralder Siunds like you are advocating private health insurance - the same as in America. As we know, that only benefits the rich.

@grenjs @latimeralder If you want an organization with durably quality service, you need to align the incentives of everyone within to meet the desired outcome.

You can't do this without competition and choice.  Free markets are the only way.  Everything else leads us to a poorly run zoo.

@latimeralder @PrincessofWails If you create a relationship where an emergency benefits a group of people, those people will endeavor to create that emergency.

Insane how people can't see this happening and understand why it happens.  Just people following corrupted incentives.  Stealing is wrong, always.
@latimeralder Which comes back to exactly what I said. The NHS needs to be re-organised and for the dead wood staff to be laid off. I'm glad that's sorted.
@grenjs Then they are contributing to healthcare.
@latimeralder So who is going to manage the demand for healthcare medical supplies, the appointment of NHS staff, the front line shift rotations and holiday requests etc etc etc.
@grenjs If they're not contributing to healthcare, nobody.
@latimeralder Who do you suggest should pay them?
@grenjs If they're no thelping to provide our healthcare in some capacity, why are we paying them from the NHS budget at all?
